ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Hmmm.  Someone else looking at DAoC?
ygData.msgSnippet: Couple additional points, loot is automatically lotto d in groups. Quest items go to questers but everything else is random. In addition to anti-twinking
ygData.messageBody:
Couple additional points, loot is automatically lotto'd in groups. Quest
items go to questers but everything else is random.

In addition to anti-twinking there's anti-camping features.

1) You get a camp XP bonus that is pretty nice but goes down the longer
you stay at a camp.

2) Except for quest items, drops are random. There's very little NPC
camping.

3) You only get drops if you are in level range to get XP. If it's gray
you'll never get loot from it.

All this makes money very tight. You have to keep upgrading your equipment
as you level and you can't extra cash by camping low level trash.

Btw, the quality of the game at release is really phenominal. Mystic did a
great job. Not too crowded, no serious bugs and tons of fun low level
quests and tasks to get items, cash and XP.

Finally, a couple of my favorite features are the tradeskills and
grouping. Trades are done very well and, while very expensive, promise
equipment superior to drops or store bought (real income!). The grouping
interface shows you which groups are looking for people, who is solo lfg
and shows group leaders who is lfg by the class they need. Level range and
distance are set automatically.

Tzeetch, 55 Troubador of Xegony

Asmerelda, 9th Healer and Jr. Apprentice Armourer (141) of Lancelot

--- Mike Finger <mike_finger@...> wrote:

<HR>
<html><body>
<tt>
I was also in the last beta.<BR>
<BR>
The other thing is that weapons are rated compared to your ability to
use<BR>
them.  If you use a weapon that is better than you are then you are
unable<BR>
to use it to its maximum potentional.  If it is way above you, you
can<BR>
actually damage the weapon by using it, probably since you would be<BR>
incapable of using it correctly.<BR>
<BR>
Nice twist on anti-twinking.<BR>
<BR>
Looting is different.  When the MOB dies it drops stuff on the
ground, you<BR>
need to select it and get it.  Your loot is your loot, no one else
can pick<BR>
it up.  On the downside, if someone doesn't want the loot and leaves
it<BR>
there, you cannot ever take it.  I do beleive it is theirs until
it<BR>
disappears.<BR>
<BR>
----- Original Message -----<BR>
From: Drewt Drumslinger <drewt@...><BR>
To: <eqbards@yahoogroups.com><BR>
Sent: Friday, October 12, 2001 8:19 AM<BR>
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Hmmm. Someone else looking at DAoC?<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
> I had the opportunity to Beta test DAoC.  I was impressed.<BR>
> A lot of unique things in DAoC that you don't see in EQ but might
wish you<BR>
did.<BR>
><BR>
> A few examples:<BR>
> 1.)  Equipment and Armor degrades as you use it.  If it
degrades far<BR>
enough<BR>
> you'll have to run to town and get it "refreshed" to keep
the stats up.<BR>
> 2.)  Any player can bind him/herself to any city/town/village
bind point.<BR>
> Commmand:  /bind<BR>
> 3.)  Seems to be a lot more low and midlevel quests for
experience.  Every<BR>
visit<BR>
> to "guild master" presents a new quest.<BR>
><BR>
> I started many characters in each of the realms to "try"
them out, didn't<BR>
get to<BR>
> level many of them up very far.<BR>
><BR>
> That's all that comes to mind at the moment.  If you're playing
feel free<BR>
to<BR>
> elaborate.<BR>
> Still need to run out and get my copy of DAoC, Beta is over and I'm
cut<BR>
off at<BR>
> the moment.<BR>
><BR>
> - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -<BR>
> Drewt Drumslinger<BR>
> 23rd Level Half-Elf Bard of Veeshan<BR>
> Solusek Ro - The Burning Prince Deity<BR>
><BR>
> "For every reaction, there is an equal and opposite
action"<BR>
><BR>
><BR>
><BR>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
lol@...<BR>
with the subject submissions.<BR>
><BR>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to <a
href="http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/">http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/</a><BR>
><BR>
><BR>
><BR>
<BR>
</tt>

<br>
